item.title: Steter Exit-Tropfen trifft auf hitzige Investorenerwartungen

item.description: Nach zwei Jahren fast vollständig geschlossener Exit-Pipeline zeigt der Private-Equity-Markt 2025 erstmals wieder Bewegung. Von einem echten Neustart kann jedoch keine Rede sein. item.title: Wie das Putin-Regime ukrainische Kinder zu patriotischen Russen umerzieht
item.author: Neue Zürcher Zeitung - Internationale Ausgabe
item.description: Russland hat mit der Besetzung eines Fünftels der Ukraine Hunderttausende von Kindern in seine Gewalt gebracht. Das Putin-Regime zwingt sie, die russische Kultur anzunehmen; manche werden sogar ihren Verwandten weggenommen. Die 11-jährige Kira wurde laut ukrainischen Regierungsangaben beim russische...

item.title: DIE WELT 2026 ANPASSUNG STATT AUFBRUCH

item.title: Inga vom Holtz – Die Zukunftsmacherin

item.description: Wo andere Risiken sehen, erkennt Inga vom Holtz Chancen. Sie ist eine der prägendsten Frühphasen-Investorinnen in Deutschland – jemand, der nicht wartet, bis alles perfekt ist, sondern Gründerinnen und Gründern genau dann Kapital und Vertrauen gibt, wenn es am meisten zählt: ganz am Anfang. item.title: ECB Holds Rates With Growth Firmer and Inflation Near Target
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged for a fourth straight meeting as inflation hovers around target and the euro zone weathers global shocks. The deposit rate was kept at 2% on Thursday — as predicted by all analysts in a Bloomberg survey. Policymakers continued to...

item.title: Catastrophe Bonds Targeting Wildfires Lose ‘Untouchable’ Status
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Alternative investment managers are starting to take a serious interest in catastrophe bonds tied to wildfires, moving into a risk category that just a few years ago was seen as too difficult to model. More than $5 billion of cat bonds with some level of exposure to wildfire risk were...

item.title: Lagarde Urges Look at ECB Board Rules as Schnabel Eyes Her Job
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Christine Lagarde said lawyers previously reckoned that a serving European Central Bank Executive Board member would be ineligible for the presidency, but she called for more study on the matter. After Isabel Schnabel’s remarks published last week revealing ambitions to succeed to the...

item.title: ECB Officials Say Cycle of Rate Cuts Is Most Likely Over
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank officials expect the cycle of interest-rate cuts to most likely be finished based on the latest outlook for growth and inflation, according to people familiar with the debate. Unless there’s another major shock, the deposit rate should be able to stay at 2% foll...

item.title: ECB to Hold With Economy on Sturdier Footing: Decision Guide
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank is set to keep interest rates unchanged for a fourth meeting with new economic projections likely to point to solid growth and policymakers confident inflation won’t stray excessively from their target. The deposit rate will be held at 2% on Thursday, accordi...

item.title: AI Startup Edison Raises $70 Million to Speed Up Scientific Research
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- A startup building artificial intelligence software to speed up and automate scientific research has raised $70 million in a new funding round, the latest sign of investor enthusiasm for using AI in the sciences. The financing for Edison Scientific, announced Thursday, was co-led by S...

item.title: BlackRock Co-Head of $26 Billion Multi-Asset Income Team to Exit
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc.’s Alex Shingler plans to leave in early 2026 after 18 years with the world’s largest asset manager, where he’s co-head of income investing in the multi-asset business.
